      game.Players.LocalPlayer:Kick()
   end
end

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetServerTi.documentation: Returns the server epoch time in seconds

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.JoinToOutsi.documentation: An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be made.
The Enum.JointCreationMode to be used. Passing in enum.JointCreationMode or enum.JointCreationMode has the same behavior which equates to Join Always
Creates joints between the specified BasePart and any touching parts depending on the parts' surfaces and the specified joint creation mode.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.MakeJoints/.documentation: An array of BasePart for whom joints are to be made

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.MakeJoints.documentation: Goes through all BaseParts given. If any part's side has a Enum.SurfaceType that can make a joint it will create a joint with any adjacent parts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.PGSIsEnable.documentation: True if the PGS solver is enabled.
Returns true if the game has the PGS Physics solver enabled.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.SetPhysicsT.documentation: Whether or not physics throttling is enabled.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.UnjoinFromO.documentation: An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be broken.
Breaks all joints between the specified BaseParts and other BaseParts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.ZoomToExten.documentation: Positions and zooms the Workspace.CurrentCamera to show the extent of BaseParts currently in the Workspace.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.ArePartsTou.documentation: A list of parts checks to see if any parts in the list are touching any parts not in the list
The part overlap threshold in studs that is ignored before parts are considered to be touching
True iff any of the Part in partList are touching any other parts (parts not in the partList). False if no parts are passed.
Returns true if any of the given BasePart are touching any other parts
@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.ArePartsTou.code_sample:
-- Create 2 parts that overlap 1 stud
local part1 = Instance.new("Part")
part1.Name = "Part1"
part1.Anchored = true
part1.Parent = workspace
part1.Transparency = 0.5
part1.Color = Color3.new(385, 100, 38)
part1.Size = Vector3.new(2, 2, 2)
part1.Position = Vector3.new(0, 4, 0)

local part2 = Instance.new("Part")
part2.Name = "Part2"
part2.Anchored = true
part2.Parent = workspace
part2.Transparency = 0.5
part2.Color = Color3.new(200, 10, 0)
part2.Size = Vector3.new(2, 2, 2)
part2.Position = Vector3.new(0, 5, 0)

local partList = { part1 }

print(workspace:ArePartsTouchingOthers(partList, 0)) -- True
print(workspace:ArePartsTouchingOthers(partList, 0.999)) -- True
print(workspace:ArePartsTouchingOthers(partList, 1)) -- False

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.BulkMoveTo.documentation: Moves a table of Part to DataType.CFrame in a table of CFrames, without firing property changed events

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.documentation: The maximum amount of BaseParts to be returned.
Returns an array of BaseParts in the given DataType.Region3.
@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.code_sample:
local Point1 = Vector3.new(0,0,0)
local Point2 = Vector3.new(10,10,10)
local Region = Region3.new(Point1,Point2)
for _,Part in pairs(game.Workspace:FindPartsInRegion3(Region,nil,math.huge)) do
  print(Part.Name)
end

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.documentation: An array of objects to be ignored.
The maximum number of BaseParts to be returned.
Returns an array of BaseParts in the given DataType.Region3 that aren't in, or a descendant of an entry in, the given IgnoreList.
@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

function findPartsExcludingCharacters(region3, maxParts)
	-- build an ignore list of all characters
	local ignoreList = {}
	for _, player in pairs(Players:GetPlayers()) do
		if player and player.Character then
			table.insert(ignoreList, player.Character)
		end
	end	
	-- return region3 search
	return workspace:FindPartsInRegion3WithIgnoreList(region3, ignoreList, maxParts)
end

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.documentation: The maximum number of BaseParts to be returned.
Returns an array of BaseParts in the given DataType.Region3 that are in, or descendant of an object in, a given white list.
@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.code_sample:
-- Set up Region3 and return only the red parts
parts = workspace:FindPartsInRegion3WithWhiteList(Region3.new(Vector3.new(-100,-20,-100),Vector3.new(100,20,100)), {workspace.Reds}, 1000)

-- loop through the parts array and print the name of each part
for partIndex, part in pairs(parts) do 
	print(part.Name) 
end

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.IKMoveTo/pa.documentation: The location to move the specified part
A number between 0 and 1 specifying how aggressively to match the part's position to the position part of the target DataType.CFrame
A number between 0 and 1 specifying how aggresively to match the part's rotation to to the rotation part of the target DataType.CFrame
Allows you to specify what objects should be effected by the physical resolution

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.IKMoveTo.documentation: Moves the specified part to the specified location via inverse kinematics rather than moving it there directly, to ensure any joints, constraints, or collisions that part is participating in remain physically satisfied

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.IsRegion3Em.documentation: Returns a bool indicating whether there are no BaseParts within the given DataType.Region3.
An array of objects to be ignored.
Returns a bool indicating whether there are no BaseParts within in the given DataType.Region3, ignoring any BaseParts that are descendants of the objects within the given ignore list.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.Raycast/par.documentation: The directional vector of the ray. Note that the length of this vector matters, as parts/terrain further away than its length will not be tested.
An object used to specify hit eligibility in the raycast operation. If not provided, default values are used where all parts are considered and Terrain water is not ignored.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.Raycast/ret.documentation: Contains the results of a raycast operation, or nil if no eligible BasePart or Terrain cell was hit.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.Raycast.documentation: Casts a ray using an origin, direction, and optional datatype.RaycastParams, then returns a datatype.RaycastResult if an eligible object or terrain intersects the ray.
@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.Raycast.code_sample:
-- Build a "RaycastParams" object
local raycastParams = RaycastParams.new()
raycastParams.FilterType = Enum.RaycastFilterType.Whitelist
raycastParams.FilterDescendantsInstances = {workspace.Model}
raycastParams.IgnoreWater = true

-- Cast the ray
local part = workspace.Part
local raycastResult = workspace:Raycast(part.Position, part.CFrame.LookVector*50, raycastParams)

-- Interpret the result
if raycastResult then
	print("Object/terrain hit:", raycastResult.Instance:GetFullName())
	print("Hit position:", raycastResult.Position)
	print("Surface normal at the point of intersection:", raycastResult.Normal)
	print("Material hit:", raycastResult.Material.Name)
else
	print("Nothing was hit!")
end

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartOnR.documentation: The BasePart or Terrain cell hit, the DataType.Vector3 point of intersection, the DataType.Vector3 surface normal at the point of intersection, and the Enum.Material of the BasePart or terrain cell hit.
Returns the first BasePart or Terrain cell intersecting with the given DataType.Ray

The BasePart or Terrain cell hit, the DataType.Vector3 point of intersection, the DataType.Vector3 surface normal at the point of intersection, and the Enum.Material of the BasePart or terrain cell hit.
Returns the first BasePart or Terrain cell intersecting with the given DataType.Ray that isn't in, nor is a descendant of an object in, the given ignore list

The BasePart or Terrain cell hit, the DataType.Vector3 point of intersection, the DataType.Vector3 surface normal at the point of intersection, and the Enum.Material of the BasePart or terrain cell hit.
Returns the first BasePart or Terrain cell intersecting with the given DataType.Ray that is in, or is a descendant of an object in, the given whitelist

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.documentation: The WrapLayer object defines a 3D accessory’s inner and outer surfaces and other properties related to layering accessories. These surfaces, or the Inner Cage and Outer Cage, are similar to collision boxes, and describe the surfaces of which other 3D accessories can be placed without clipping or breaking.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.Enabled.documentation: Allows for disabling of the WrapLayer object as if it does not exist.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.ReferenceMe.documentation: AssetID for reference mesh used to define Inner Cage of a 3D object

@roblox/globaltype/WrapTarget.Color.documentation: Sets color used for the debug rendering. See WrapTarget.DebugMode

@roblox/globaltype/WrapTarget.Stiffness.documentation: Defines how much the body mesh can be compressed by clothing.

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.Attachme.documentation: The constraint is expressed relative to Attatchment0
The constraint is expressed relative to Attatchment1

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.World.documentation: The constraint is expressed relative to the game world

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.Overlay.documentation: Overlays the SurfaceAppearance.ColorMap on top of the underlying part color based on the ColorMap’s alpha channel

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.Transparency.documentation: Overlays the SurfaceAppearance.ColorMap on top of the underlying part Part.Color3 color based on the ColorMap’s alpha channel

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Defa.documentation: Default action. Used for an undefined Action

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Acqu.documentation: Indicates the acquisition of an in game resource. For example, a player acquires virtual currency by completing a specific in game task

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Spen.documentation: Indicates the spending or loss of an in game resource. For example, a player spends virtual currency to acquire a new item

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Trace.documentation: Trace is the noisiest level, rarely (if ever) enabled for a production app

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Error.documentation: When functionality is unavailable or expectations broken

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Fatal.documentation: The most critical level, Fatal events demand immediate attention

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsProgressionStatus..documentation: Default status. Used for an undefined status

@roblox/enum/AspectType.FitWithinMaxSize.documentation: Makes the element the maximum size it can be within the current possible AbsoluteSize of the element while maintaining the aspect ratio

@roblox/enum/AspectType.ScaleWithParentS.documentation: Scales the element to the largest size it can fit inside the parent element’s maximum size while maintaining the aspect ratio

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Lua.documentation: The asset is Lua code, for example a ModuleScript.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Animation.documentation: The asset is an animation; also see the more specific animation type enums below.

@roblox/enum/AssetType.Package.documentation: The asset is a pack, for example an animation package.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.X.documentation: Automatically resize element along X-axis to fit child contents

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.Y.documentation: Automatically resize element along Y-axis to fit child contents. Text Objects will only resize along the Y-axis if TextWrapped is enabled

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.XY.documentation: Automatically resize element along X and Y axes to fit child contents

@roblox/enum/BorderMode.Outline.documentation: As GuiObject.BorderSizePixel increases, the border grows outward. The dimensions of the GuiObject's contents do not change.

@roblox/enum/BorderMode.Middle.documentation: As GuiObject.BorderSizePixel increases, the border grows evenly inward and outward. The dimensions of the GuiObject's contents are reduced at a 1:1 ratio.

@roblox/enum/BorderMode.Inset.documentation: As GuiObject.BorderSizePixel increases, the border grows evenly inward only. The dimensions of the GuiObject's contents are reduced at a 1:2 ratio.

@roblox/enum/CameraMode.Classic.documentation: Third-person camera which can be zoomed into first-person.

@roblox/enum/CameraPanMode.Classic.documentation: Enables swipe and pan on mobile devices, and disables edge bump camera controls. Default.

@roblox/enum/CameraPanMode.EdgeBump.documentation: Disables swipe to pan on mobile devices, and enables edge bump camera controls. It does not affect PC or Mac users.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Watch.documentation: Camera is stationary but will rotate to keep the subject in the center of the screen.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Attach.documentation: Camera moves with the subject at a fixed offset and will rotate as the subject rotates.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Track.documentation: Camera moves with the subject but does not rotate automatically.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Follow.documentation: Camera moves with the subject and rotates to keep the subject in the center.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Custom.documentation: Default mode used by Roblox Core Scripts.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Scriptable.documentation: No default behavior. Used when developers need to script custom behavior.

@roblox/enum/CameraType.Orbital.documentation: The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.

@roblox/enum/ChatMode.Menu.documentation: The player is restricted to chatting via a menu of chat messages.

@roblox/enum/ChatMode.TextAndMenu.documentation: A player can chat via custom text messages and a menu of chat messages.

@roblox/enum/ChatPrivacyMode.AllUsers.documentation: A player can chat with all users in a game.

@roblox/enum/ChatPrivacyMode.NoOne.documentation: A player cannot chat with any other users in a game.

@roblox/enum/ChatPrivacyMode.Friends.documentation: A player can only chat with users in a game that are on their friends list.

@roblox/enum/ChatStyle.Classic.documentation: Displays chats in the chat user interface at the top-left corner of the screen.

@roblox/enum/ChatStyle.Bubble.documentation: Displays chats in a bubble above the sender's head.

@roblox/enum/ChatStyle.ClassicAndBubble.documentation: Has the effects of Classic and Bubble combined.

@roblox/enum/CollisionFidelity.Box.documentation: Collision models behave using a box that corresponds to the union's selection box

@roblox/enum/ComputerCameraMovementMode..documentation: The default camera movement mode is classic.
Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right.
Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right.
The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.

@roblox/enum/ComputerMovementMode.Keyboa.documentation: The player's character is controlled using the keyboard and mouse.

@roblox/enum/ComputerMovementMode.ClickT.documentation: The player can right click in the game world and the character will move there. Player can also control character with mouse and keyboard.

@roblox/enum/ContextActionResult.Pass.documentation: If functionToBind from ContextActionService.BindAction returns Enum.ContextActionResult.Pass, the input event is considered to have not been handled by functionToBind and will continue being passed to actions bound to the same input type.

@roblox/enum/ContextActionResult.Sink.documentation: If functionToBind from ContextActionService.BindAction returns Enum.ContextActionResult.Sink, the input event will stop at that function and no other bound actions under it will be . This is the default behavior if functionToBind does not return anything or yields in any way.

@roblox/enum/ControlMode.MouseLockSwitch.documentation: Similar to classic, but allows the player to toggle mouse locking, causing the camera to rotate as the player moves the mouse (without holding down a button).

@roblox/enum/ControlMode.Classic.documentation: Allows the camera to be moved by clicking and dragging with the right mouse button.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.PlayerList.documentation: The CoreGui displaying the list of in-game players.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.Backpack.documentation: The CoreGui displaying a player's backpack (containing a player's tools, gear, etc.).

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.Chat.documentation: The CoreGui used to display and send in-game chat message with other players.

@roblox/enum/CoreGuiType.EmotesMenu.documentation: Allows the Emotes Menu to be disabled using the existing StarterGui.SetCoreGuiEnabled API. Disabling all CoreGui types using /Enum/CoreGuiType/All would also disable the Emotes Menu.

@roblox/enum/CreatorType.User.documentation: The place is owned by a single user

@roblox/enum/CreatorType.Group.documentation: The place is owned by a group

@roblox/enum/CustomCameraMode.Follow.documentation: Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right

@roblox/enum/CustomCameraMode.Classic.documentation: Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right

@roblox/enum/DevCameraOcclusionMode.Zoom.documentation: Camera will zoom in until there is nothing between the player and camera.

@roblox/enum/DevCameraOcclusionMode.Invi.documentation: Any objects between the camera and player will become translucent locally.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerCameraMovementMo.documentation: The camera will move based on the player's settings.
Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right.
Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right.
The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Use.documentation: The player's character will moved based on the user's settings.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Key.documentation: The player's character will be controlled using the keyboard and mouse.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Cli.documentation: The player can right click in the game world and the character will move there. Player can also control character with mouse and keyboard.

@roblox/enum/DevComputerMovementMode.Scr.documentation: The player will not respond to default controls; any character movement must be defined in custom scripts.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Internal.documentation: General data that doesn't have any categorization. This could be due to either internal reasons, or because it simply isn't being tracked categorically.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.LuaHeap.documentation: All of the data in Lua. this includes everything happening in CoreScripts, the built-in datatypes, etc.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Script.documentation: All memory being manipulated and referenced by scripts.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.PhysicsP.documentation: Physics bodies and the components that control their behavior.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Graphics.documentation: Rendering solid models (stuff made with Union, Negate, etc.)
Spatial hash lookup tables of the game world that are used for rendering.
Rendering of textures in the game world.
Rendering of texture composition maps that are generated for Humanoids.

@roblox/enum/DeveloperMemoryTag.Animatio.documentation: Playback of Animations on Humanoids and AnimationControllers.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchCameraMovementMode..documentation: The camera will move based on the player's settings.
Camera tracks the player but will not automatically rotate if the player walks left or right.
Camera tracks the player and automatically rotates if the player walks left or right.
The camera has a fixed Y position, but can be rotated around the player.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.UserCh.documentation: The player's character will moved based on the user's settings.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Thumbs.documentation: The player's character is controlled with a virtual thumbstick that moves with the player's finger. Jumping is controlled with a separate button.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.DPad.documentation: The player's character is controlled with a virtual dpad. The dpad consists of directional buttons with a jump button in the middle.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Thumbp.documentation: The player's character is controlled with a virtual thumbpad that stays stationary as the player's finger moves. Jumping is controlled with a separate button.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.ClickT.documentation: The player's character will attempt to move to a location in the world when the player taps a location.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Script.documentation: The player will not respond to default controls; any character movement must be defined in custom scripts.

@roblox/enum/DevTouchMovementMode.Dynami.documentation: The player's character is controlled with one hand while holding their device in portrait mode.

@roblox/enum/DialogBehaviorType.SinglePl.documentation: Only one player can interact with this dialog at a time. The conversation between the player and dialog can be seen by all players.

@roblox/enum/DialogBehaviorType.Multiple.documentation: Multiple players can simultaneously interact with this dialog. The conversation between the player and the dialog cannot be seen by other players.

@roblox/enum/DialogTone.Neutral.documentation: Causes the dialog to have a blue bar on its left-hand side.

@roblox/enum/DialogTone.Friendly.documentation: Causes the dialog to have a green bar on its left-hand side.

@roblox/enum/DialogTone.Enemy.documentation: Causes the dialog to have a red bar on its left-hand side.

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Quint.documentation: Similar to Quad and Quart, but at a different speed (See animation).

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Bounce.documentation: Moves as if the start or end position of the tween is bouncy (See animation).

@roblox/enum/EasingStyle.Elastic.documentation: Moves as if the GUI element is attached to a rubber band (See animation).

@roblox/enum/ElasticBehavior.Never.documentation: The scrollbar will never have elastic scrolling available

@roblox/enum/FillDirection.Vertical.documentation: Fill in the top to bottom direction.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Symmetric.documentation: Increases by a rate of 1 along all axes.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Brick.documentation: Increases by a rate of 1 along the x- and z- axes, 1.2 along the y-axis.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Plate.documentation: Increases by a rate of 1 along the x- and z- axes, 0.4 along the y-axis.

@roblox/enum/FormFactor.Custom.documentation: Increases by a rate as low as .001 along all axes.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.Custom.documentation: Uses the frame's GuiObject.BackgroundColor3, GuiObject.BorderColor3, and GuiObject.BackgroundTransparency properties to determine the frame's appearance. It has no padding; elements with the position {{0, 0}, {0, 0}} will appear at the frame's top-left corner.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.ChatBlue.documentation: Causes the frame to appear similar to a Dialog with its Dialog.Tone property set to Enum.DialogTone neutral. This has a padding of fifteen pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.RobloxSquare.documentation: Causes the frame to appear as a translucent dark gray rectangle with a padding of five pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.RobloxRound.documentation: Causes the frame to appear as a translucent dark gray rectangle with rounded edges. Like "RobloxSquare" this has a padding of five pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.ChatGreen.documentation: Causes the frame to appear similar to a Dialog with its Tone property set to "Friendly." Like "ChatBlue" this has a padding of fifteen pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.ChatRed.documentation: Causes the frame to appear similar to a Dialog with its Tone property set to "Enemy." Like "ChatBlue" and "ChatGreen" this has a padding of fifteen pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FrameStyle.DropShadow.documentation: Causes the frame to appear as a translucent gray rectangle with blurred sides. The blur is more apparent on the bottom edge. It has a padding of eight pixels on all sides.

@roblox/enum/FriendRequestEvent.Revoke.documentation: A player revokes (cancels) a previously invoked (sent) friend request.

@roblox/enum/FriendStatus.Unknown.documentation: The friendship status of two players is unknown.

@roblox/enum/FriendStatus.FriendRequestS.documentation: At least one of two players has sent a friend request to the other player.

@roblox/enum/FriendStatus.FriendRequestR.documentation: At least one of two players has received a friend request sent by the other player.

@roblox/enum/GameAvatarType.PlayerChoice.documentation: The rig (either R6 or R15) determined by a player's character settings set on the website in the 'Edit Avatar' page.

@roblox/enum/GearGenreSetting.MatchingGe.documentation: Only gear genres matching the allowed genres specified in a place's configuration settings.

@roblox/enum/GearType.PowerUps.documentation: Gear with the 'Power Up' attribute.

@roblox/enum/Genre.All.documentation: The game's genre is set to All. The game will be listed as all possible genres.

@roblox/enum/Genre.TownAndCity.documentation: The game's genre is set to Town and City.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Fantasy.documentation: The game's genre is set to Fantasy.

@roblox/enum/Genre.SciFi.documentation: The game's genre is set to SciFi (Science Fiction).

@roblox/enum/Genre.Ninja.documentation: The game's genre is set to Ninja.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Scary.documentation: The game's genre is set to Scary.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Pirate.documentation: The game's genre is set to Pirate.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Adventure.documentation: The game's genre is set to Adventure.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Sports.documentation: The game's genre is set to Sports.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Funny.documentation: The game's genre is set to Funny.

@roblox/enum/Genre.WildWest.documentation: The game's genre is set to Wild West

@roblox/enum/Genre.War.documentation: The game's genre is set to War.

@roblox/enum/Genre.SkatePark.documentation: The game's genre is set to Skate Park.

@roblox/enum/Genre.Tutorial.documentation: The game's genre is set to Tutorial.

@roblox/enum/GraphicsMode.Automatic.documentation: Roblox will automatically decide what graphics mode to use, depending on what best suits your device's specifications.

@roblox/enum/GraphicsMode.NoGraphics.documentation: Game will not be rendered, and instead a Diagnostics window is rendered on screen.

@roblox/enum/HorizontalAlignment.Center.documentation: The grid is placed at the center of its parent (x-direction), extending equally to the left and right of the center according to the size of the grid relative to the x-axis.

@roblox/enum/HorizontalAlignment.Left.documentation: The grid is placed starting along the left edge of the parent, extending to the right according to the size of the grid relative to the x-axis.

@roblox/enum/HorizontalAlignment.Right.documentation: The grid is placed starting along the left edge of the parent, extending to the left according to the size of the grid relative to the x-axis.

@roblox/enum/HttpContentType.Application.documentation: The HTTP request data is in Json
The HTTP request data is encoded in application Xml
The HTTP request data is URL encoded

@roblox/enum/HttpContentType.TextPlain.documentation: The HTTP request data is formatted in plain text

@roblox/enum/HttpContentType.TextXml.documentation: The HTTP request data isformatted in plain text Xml

@roblox/enum/HumanoidCollisionType.Outer.documentation: Dynamically sized collision boxes based on mesh sizes

@roblox/enum/HumanoidCollisionType.Inner.documentation: Fixed size collision boxes, similar to the classic avatar collision

@roblox/enum/HumanoidDisplayDistanceType.documentation: Name and healthbar will be displayed based on the distance settings of the humanoid viewing them.
Name and healthbar will be displayed based on the distance settings of the humanoid being viewed, i.e. the one with this property set.
Name and healthbar will not be displayed under any circumstance.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidHealthDisplayType.D.documentation: The humanoid's health is only visible when the humanoid is damaged - and not at full health. The display is not visible when the humanoid is at full health.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidHealthDisplayType.A.documentation: The humanoid's health display is always visible.
The humanoid's health display is never visible.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidRigType.R6.documentation: Indicates that a character is using the legacy R6 rig.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidRigType.R15.documentation: Indicates that a character is using the new R15 rig.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.FallingDo.documentation: The Humanoid has been tripped, and will attempt to get up in a few moments.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Running.documentation: Currently running while physics of parts in range are being calculated (e.g. After a jump, close to other players, ...).

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.RunningNo.documentation: Currently running while no physics are being calculated.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Climbing.documentation: The Humanoid is climbing (e.g. up a TrussPart or ladder). This state is only found being active when stopping with climbing.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.StrafingN.documentation: Doesn't seem to be used. Cannot be set with Humanoid.ChangeState.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Ragdoll.documentation: The Humanoid has been hit by a fast moving object (uncontrolled falling). The Humanoid can recover from this.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.GettingUp.documentation: The Humanoid is getting back on their feet after ragdolling.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Jumping.documentation: The Humanoid just jumped. (Check Humanoid.Jump). This state lasts only briefly.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Landed.documentation: The Humanoid touched the ground after a freefall. This state lasts only briefly.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Flying.documentation: When set, the Humanoid won't be animated, as with the Humanoid.PlatformStand property. Lasts as long as the player flies.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Freefall.documentation: The Humanoid is currently freefalling (jumped from a height).

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Seated.documentation: The Humanoid is currently sitting. Check the Humanoid.Sit property.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.PlatformS.documentation: The Humanoid is platformstanding. Check the Humanoid.PlatformStand property.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Dead.documentation: The Humanoid died. Changing a Humanoid's state to this one will kill it.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Swimming.documentation: The Humanoid is currently swimming in Terrain water.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.Physics.documentation: The Humanoid doesn't apply any force on its own. (Unending PlatformStand) Has to be unset manually using Humanoid.ChangeState.

@roblox/enum/HumanoidStateType.None.documentation: Unusable placeholder in case an unknown state gets triggered internally.

@roblox/enum/IKCollisionsMode.NoCollisio.documentation: Only the part and any parts directly joined to it via joints/Constraint be be involved in the resolution, everything else in the workspace will be treated as though it doesn't exist.

@roblox/enum/IKCollisionsMode.OtherMecha.documentation: Only the part and any parts directly jointed to it via joints/Constraint will be moved during resolution, but they will collide with other objects in the workspace.

@roblox/enum/IKCollisionsMode.IncludeCon.documentation: The part, any parts directly joined to it via joints/Constraint, and any parts which it comes into contact with during the solve will be moved during the resolution. That is, the moved parts will be allowed to "push" other unanchored parts in the workspace out of the way in order to get to the target position.

@roblox/enum/InfoType.Asset.documentation: Asset format type - the product is an asset.

@roblox/enum/InfoType.Product.documentation: Product format type - the product is a produce (e.g. Developer product).

@roblox/enum/InfoType.GamePass.documentation: GamePass format type - the product is a GamePass.

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Top.documentation: The widget will appear docked above the game screen

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Bottom.documentation: The widget will appear docked below the game screen

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Left.documentation: The widget will appear docked to the left of the game screen

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Right.documentation: The widget will appear docked to the right of the game screen

@roblox/enum/InitialDockState.Float.documentation: The widget will not be docked to any side of the game screen, and instead can be freely dragged around

@roblox/enum/InOut.Edge.documentation: The object is located along an edge of its parent.

@roblox/enum/InOut.Inset.documentation: The object's located is inset from its parent's location.

@roblox/enum/InOut.Center.documentation: The object's location is centered on it's parent.

@roblox/enum/InputType.NoInput.documentation: Behaves like a weld, and does absolutely nothing.

@roblox/enum/InputType.Constant.documentation: Rotate at a constant velocity of BasePart ParamB.

@roblox/enum/InputType.Sin.documentation:
Rotate at a velocity of:

ParamA * math.sin(game.Workspace.DistributedGameTime * ParamB).

BasePart ParamA will determine the maximum speed at which the part will spin, and BasePart ParamB will determine how frequently it changes direction.

@roblox/enum/JointCreationMode.All.documentation: Joints are created between any kind of surface. Functions identically to Surface

@roblox/enum/JointCreationMode.Surface.documentation: Joints are created between any kind of surface. Functions identically to All

@roblox/enum/JointCreationMode.None.documentation: Joints are never created, no matter what

@roblox/enum/KeyInterpolationMode.Linear.documentation: Linear interpolation between the values of the first and second keys

@roblox/enum/KeyInterpolationMode.Cubic.documentation: Cubic interpolation of first key value and its right tangent and second key value and its left tangent.

@roblox/enum/LeftRight.Left.documentation: The object is on the left side of it's parent (x-axis).

@roblox/enum/LeftRight.Center.documentation: The object is centered on the center of it's parent (x-axis), expanding equally to the left and right of the parent's center.

@roblox/enum/LeftRight.Right.documentation: The object is on the right side of it's parent (x-axis).

@roblox/enum/Limb.Head.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Head.

@roblox/enum/Limb.Torso.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Torso. This includes UpperTorso and LowerTorso for R16 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.LeftArm.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Torso. This includes UpperLeftArm and LowerLeftArm for R16 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.RightArm.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Torso. This includes UpperRightArm and LowerRightArm for R16 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.LeftLeg.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Torso. This includes UpperLeftLeg and LowerLeftLeg for R16 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.RightLeg.documentation: If the limb is a part of the Humanoid's Torso. This includes UpperRightLeg and LowerRightLeg for R16 rigs.

@roblox/enum/Limb.Unknown.documentation: If a part is not a limb (e.g. running the Humanoid.GetLimb function on a BasePart child of a Humanoid will return this Enum).

@roblox/enum/MembershipType.None.documentation: The player does not have an active paid membership.

@roblox/enum/MembershipType.Premium.documentation: The player has an active Premium membership.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.Head.documentation: The mesh is the default Humanoid head mesh.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.Torso.documentation: The mesh is the default Humanoid torso mesh.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.RightAngleRamp.documentation: The mesh is a right angle ramp.

@roblox/enum/MeshType.Brick.documentation: The mesh is a brick (just like the shape of a default BasePart)

@roblox/enum/MeshType.FileMesh.documentation: The mesh is determined by the Roblox mesh asset id provided.

@roblox/enum/MouseBehavior.Default.documentation: The mouse moves freely around the user's screen.

@roblox/enum/MouseBehavior.LockCenter.documentation: The mouse is locked, and cannot move from, the center of the user's screen.

@roblox/enum/MouseBehavior.LockCurrentPo.documentation: The mouse is locked, and cannot move from, it's current position on the user's screen at the time of locking.

@roblox/enum/MoveState.Coasting.documentation: Skateboard is coasting (not actively speeding up / being pushed).

@roblox/enum/NetworkOwnership.Automatic.documentation: Network ownership is determined automatically by the server.

@roblox/enum/NetworkOwnership.Manual.documentation: Network ownership is set manually by the developer.

@roblox/enum/NetworkOwnership.OnContact.documentation: The first player to touch a part is given ownership of that part for the server (network). Ownership will not change if another player touches that part unless network ownership has been released by the owner.

@roblox/enum/OverrideMouseIconBehavior.N.documentation: The mouse icon behavior is not overridden - default behavior is used.

@roblox/enum/OverrideMouseIconBehavior.F.documentation: The mouse icon is forced to always remain shown/visible.
The mouse icon is forced to always remain hidden/invisible.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.ClosestNoPath.documentation: Path doesn't exist, returns path to closest point.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.ClosestOutOfRang.documentation: Goal is out of MaxDistance range, returns path to closest point you can reach within MaxDistance.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.FailStartNotEmpt.documentation: Failed to compute path; the starting point is not empty.

@roblox/enum/PathStatus.FailFinishNotEmp.documentation: Failed to compute path; the finish point is not empty.

@roblox/enum/PathWaypointAction.Walk.documentation: Walk action needed to reach the next waypoint

@roblox/enum/PathWaypointAction.Jump.documentation: Jump action needed to reach the next waypoint

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Game.documentation: Member must have no security permissions in order to be shown.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Roblox.documentation: Member must have security permissions <= RobloxPlaceSecurity to be shown.
Member must have security permissions <= RobloxScriptSecurity to be shown.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Studio.documentation: Member must have security permissions <= LocalUserSecurity to be shown.

@roblox/enum/PermissionLevelShown.Roblox.documentation: Member is shown no matter what security it has.

@roblox/enum/Platform.Windows.documentation: The client is running on a Windows Operating System.

@roblox/enum/Platform.OSX.documentation: The client is running on OSX (Apple desktop).

@roblox/enum/Platform.IOS.documentation: The client is running on IOS (Apple mobile).

@roblox/enum/Platform.Android.documentation: The client is running on Android (Google mobile).

@roblox/enum/Platform.XBoxOne.documentation: The client is running on an XBox One (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.PS4.documentation: The client is running on a PS4 (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.PS3.documentation: The client is running on a PS3 (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.XBox360.documentation: The client is running on an XBox 360 (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.WiiU.documentation: The client is running on a Wii U (console).

@roblox/enum/Platform.NX.documentation: The client is running on an NX Operating System (Cisco Nexus).

@roblox/enum/Platform.Ouya.documentation: The client is running on an Ouya Operating System (Android-Based).

@roblox/enum/Platform.AndroidTV.documentation: The client is running on an Android TV.

@roblox/enum/Platform.Linux.documentation: The client is running on a Linux Operating System (desktop).

@roblox/enum/PlaybackState.Paused.documentation: The tween is paused in the middle of playing.

@roblox/enum/PlayerChatType.All.documentation: A global message that everyone can receive.

@roblox/enum/PlayerChatType.Team.documentation: A team message only players in the same team can receive.

@roblox/enum/PlayerChatType.Whisper.documentation: A whispered message only the person it's whispered to can receive.

@roblox/enum/ProductPurchaseDecision.Not.documentation: The purchase request has been sent but not yet processed.

@roblox/enum/ProductPurchaseDecision.Pur.documentation: The purchase has been processed and granted to the user who initiated the purchase request.

@roblox/enum/ProximityPromptExclusivity..documentation: Only one prompt will be shown with this setting
One prompt will be shown per input enum.KeyCode
This prompt will always show when in range and visible

@roblox/enum/ProximityPromptStyle.Custom.documentation: Custom prompt UI style as set by the developer. For more information, see ProximityPrompt.Style

@roblox/enum/QualityLevel.Automatic.documentation: The quality level of graphics is determined automatically depending on the client's setting for either game performance or graphic quality.

@roblox/enum/QualityLevel.Level01.documentation: Graphic quality level 1 - the lowest quality level.

@roblox/enum/QualityLevel.Level21.documentation: Graphic quality level 21 - the highest quality level.

@roblox/enum/RaycastFilterType.Blacklist.documentation: Every BasePart in the game will be considered except those that are descendants of objects in the filter list.

@roblox/enum/RaycastFilterType.Whitelist.documentation: Only BasePart which are descendants of objects in the filter list will be considered in the raycast operation.

@roblox/enum/RenderFidelity.Automatic.documentation: Dynamically control a solid-modeled and mesh part’s level of detail depending on its distance from the camera (see table above)

@roblox/enum/RenderFidelity.Precise.documentation: Specifically set a solid-modeled and mesh part’s level of detail regardless of its distance from the camera (lowest, medium, or highest)

@roblox/enum/RenderFidelity.Performance.documentation: Push performance as much as possible, trying to maintain quality if possible, and discarding appearance if that's necessary to reach performance. This means that the performance will always be excellent, but mesh visuals may be affected negatively

@roblox/enum/RenderPriority.Last.documentation: This should run as last, after Character

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.NoReverb.documentation: No sound reverb. Audio is not changed from default.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.GenericReverb.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to a generic reverb effect.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.PaddedCell.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a padded cell.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Room.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a room.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Bathroom.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is a bathroom.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.LivingRoom.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a living room.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.StoneRoom.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a stone room.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Auditorium.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in an auditorium.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.ConcertHall.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a concert hall.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Cave.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a cave.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Arena.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in an arena.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Hangar.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a hangar.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.CarpettedHallway.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a carpeted hallway.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Hallway.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a hallway.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.StoneCorridor.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is a stone corridor.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Alley.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in an alley.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Forest.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a forest.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.City.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in city.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Mountains.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in the mountains.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Quarry.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a quarry.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.Plain.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is an open plain.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.ParkingLot.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a parking lot.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.SewerPipe.documentation: Sound reverb is changed to sound like the player is in a sewer pipe.

@roblox/enum/ReverbType.UnderWater.documentation: Sound reverb makes it sound like the player is under water.

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.Inverse.documentation: Volume attenuates from Sound.EmitterSize in an inverse manner

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.Linear.documentation: A hybrid model. Follows the Inverse model when close to Sound.EmitterSize and the Linear Square model when close to Sound.MaxDistance

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.InverseTapered.documentation: Volume attenuates between Sound.EmitterSize and Sound.MaxDistance with a linear relationship

@roblox/enum/RollOffMode.LinearSquare.documentation: Volume attenuates between Sound.EmitterSize and Sound.MaxDistance with a linear squared relationship

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Stretch.documentation: The image is stretched to fit within the element.

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Slice.documentation: The part of the image contained within the ImageLabel.SliceCenter or ImageButton.SliceCenter maintains its aspect ratio within the element, while everything outside is stretched and used as borders.

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Tile.documentation: The image is is tiled to fit within the element. For example, if the element is twice the X dimension of the image, the image will appear twice (2 tiles).

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Fit.documentation: The image is scaled fit within the element X or Y dimension (whichever fits first).

@roblox/enum/ScaleType.Crop.documentation: The image is cropped to fit within the element.

@roblox/enum/ScreenOrientation.Landscape.documentation: A preference where the game is displayed landscape (horizontally) with the bottom of the device on the left side of the screen.
A preference where the game is displayed landscape (horizontally) with the bottom of the device on the right side of the screen.

A preference where the game is displayed landscape (horizontally) with the bottom of the device on the left of right side of the screen depending on the device's orientation (the sensor determines which side allows for the game to be displayed right-side-up).

@roblox/enum/ScreenOrientation.Portrait.documentation: A preference where the game is displayed portrait (vertically) with the bottom of the device on the bottom of the screen.

@roblox/enum/ScreenOrientation.Sensor.documentation: A preference where the game is displayed depending on the best match to the device's current orientation - either landscape (left/right) or portrait.

@roblox/enum/ScrollBarInset.None.documentation: The ScrollingFrame will never be insetted for this scrolling bar.

@roblox/enum/ScrollBarInset.ScrollBar.documentation: The ScrollingFrame will only be insetted if this scrollbar is being shown.

@roblox/enum/ScrollBarInset.Always.documentation: The ScrollingFrame will always be insetted regardless if the scrollbar is being shown or not.

@roblox/enum/ScrollingDirection.X.documentation: Canvas can only be scrolled along the X axis

@roblox/enum/ScrollingDirection.Y.documentation: Canvas can only be scrolled along the Y axis

@roblox/enum/ScrollingDirection.XY.documentation: Canvas can be scrolled along both X and Y axes

@roblox/enum/SizeConstraint.RelativeXY.documentation: The scale of X and Y are independent.

@roblox/enum/SizeConstraint.RelativeXX.documentation: The scale of X is shared with Y

@roblox/enum/SizeConstraint.RelativeYY.documentation: The scale of Y is shared with X

@roblox/enum/SortOrder.LayoutOrder.documentation: Elements will be ordered by LayoutOrder in ascending order (e.g. 0 will be placed before 1).

@roblox/enum/SortOrder.Name.documentation: Elements will be ordered by their name in alphabetical order (e.g. Apple will be placed before Banana).

@roblox/enum/StreamingPauseMode.Disabled.documentation: No change to gameplay due to streaming region availability

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.MainB.documentation: The primary background color used by the ribbon bar and windows

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Dropd.documentation: The color of dropdown menus, like those found in the Properties window

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Toolt.documentation: The background color of tooltips, like those seen when hovering over buttons on the ribbon bar or properties in the Properties window

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Scrol.documentation: The color of scrollbar handles, like those seen in the Explorer window
The background color of scrollbars, like those seen in the Explorer window

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.TabBa.documentation: The background color of the tab bar, like the one where the script editor is opened

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Tab.documentation: The color of tabs on the tab bar, like the ones opened when the script editor is opened

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Ribbo.documentation: The color of a tab on the ribbon menu (e.g. Home, Model, Test)
The background color of the ribbon menu

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.MainB.documentation: The background color of clickable buttons that are the primary action

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Ribbo.documentation: The background color of buttons on the ribbon menu

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.ViewP.documentation: The background color of the game viewport

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Input.documentation: The background color of input fields, like those found in the Explorer window

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.GameS.documentation: The color of items within tables in the game settings window
The color of tooltips in the game settings window

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Emula.documentation: The color of the bar shown when the mobile emulator is active
The color of the device and physical size dropdowns in the emulator bar

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Color.documentation: The background color of the color picker

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Borde.documentation: The color of borders, like those found in the Properties window

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Shado.documentation: The color of shadows rendered under floating items like dropdowns

@roblox/enum/StudioStyleGuideColor.Statu.documentation: The color of the status bar shown at the bottom of Studio, if it is visible

@roblox/enum/SurfaceConstraint.Hinge.documentation: Makes the side appear with a yellow hinge. Any part connected to this hinge will stick to the side and rotate using physics

@roblox/enum/SurfaceConstraint.SteppingM.documentation: Functions identically to a motor. It may have functioned differently in the past, but that functionality no longer seems to exist.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceConstraint.Motor.documentation: Acts the same as a Hinge, but has a grey ring around it and automatically rotates any part connected to it.

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Smooth.documentation: Makes the side appear without any surface detail (except for outlines)

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Glue.documentation: Makes the side appear with thick diagonal "X"s

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Weld.documentation: Makes the side appear with thick diagonal "X"s

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Studs.documentation: Makes the side appear with square studs

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Inlet.documentation: Makes the side appear with holes where studs would be

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Universal.documentation: Makes the side appear with both Studs and Inlets in a checker pattern

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Hinge.documentation: Makes the side appear with a yellow hinge. Any part connected to this hinge will stick to the side and rotate using physics, however, using HingeConstraint to join parts is preferred

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.Motor.documentation: Acts the same as a Hinge, but has a grey ring around it and automatically rotates any part connected to it, however, using HingeConstraint to join parts is preferred

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.SteppingMotor.documentation: Functions identically to a motor. It may have functioned differently in the past, but that functionality no longer seems to exist

@roblox/enum/SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutline.documentation: Same as Smooth, but removes the outlines of the surface

@roblox/enum/SwipeDirection.None.documentation: The user did not swipe in a certain direction.

@roblox/enum/Technology.Compatibility.documentation: An approximation of Legacy rendering using newer Future is Bright technology. More details

@roblox/enum/Technology.Voxel.documentation: Future-Is-Bright lighting features. Shadows are created using a 4x4x4 voxel map.

@roblox/enum/Technology.ShadowMap.documentation: Future-Is-Bright lighting features. Features crisp shadows.

@roblox/enum/Technology.Legacy.documentation: Lighting technology that predates Future-Is-Bright. It is no longer available.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.Failure.documentation: The teleport failed for an unknown reason!

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.GameNotFound.documentation: The game that this player attempted to teleport to could not be found.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.GameEnded.documentation: The game that this player attempted to teleport to has ended.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.GameFull.documentation: The game that this player attempted to teleport to is full.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.Unauthorized.documentation: The player is not authorized to complete this teleport.

@roblox/enum/TeleportResult.Flooded.documentation: Too many teleport requests have been made recently.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.RequestedFrom.documentation: The server has requested that the client teleport.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.Started.documentation: The client has started attempting to teleport.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.WaitingForSer.documentation: The client is waiting for the server to respond to the teleport request.

@roblox/enum/TeleportState.InProgress.documentation: The teleport is currently in progress. The player usually disconnects and teleports to the destination after this.

@roblox/enum/TeleportType.ToPlace.documentation: The teleport destination is a place (no specific instance).

@roblox/enum/TeleportType.ToInstance.documentation: The teleport destination is an instance of a place.

@roblox/enum/TeleportType.ToReservedServ.documentation: The destination of the teleport is a reserved server (a place instance that is reserved for a select group of players).

@roblox/enum/TextTruncate.AtEnd.documentation: Text is truncated at the end of the text.

@roblox/enum/TextureMode.Stretch.documentation: The texture will be stretched out based on the lifetime of the trail, and will shrink inwards if the trail stops moving.

@roblox/enum/TextureMode.Wrap.documentation: The texture will be tiled as the length of the trail changes, but the textures will remain stationary relative to their attachments.

@roblox/enum/TextureMode.Static.documentation: The texture will be rolled out as the attachments move, and they will remain in place until their lifetime is met.

@roblox/enum/TextXAlignment.Left.documentation: Alignment starts at the left side of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/TextXAlignment.Center.documentation: Aligned starts at the center of the GUI object and spreads equally left and right.

@roblox/enum/TextXAlignment.Right.documentation: Alignment starts at the right side of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/TextYAlignment.Top.documentation: Alignment starts at the top of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/TextYAlignment.Center.documentation: Aligned starts at the center of the GUI object and spreads equally toward the top and bottom.

@roblox/enum/TextYAlignment.Bottom.documentation: Alignment starts at the bottom of the GUI object.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailType.HeadShot.documentation: The returned thumbnail shows just the headshot (head and up) of the user's avatar.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailType.AvatarBust.documentation: The returned thumbnail shows the bust (chest up) of the user's avatar.

@roblox/enum/ThumbnailType.AvatarThumbna.documentation: The returned thumbnail shows the entire body of the user's avatar.

@roblox/enum/TickCountSampleMethod.Fast.documentation: Compute time using a faster, but less precise method.

@roblox/enum/TickCountSampleMethod.Bench.documentation: Dynamically decide between using ''Fast'' and ''Precise'' depending on performance.

@roblox/enum/TopBottom.Center.documentation: The object is centered around the center of its parent.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Def.documentation: Default mode used by Roblox Core Scripts.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Fol.documentation: Camera moves with the subject and rotates to keep the subject in the center.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Cla.documentation: Default mode used by Roblox Core Scripts.

@roblox/enum/TouchCameraMovementMode.Orb.documentation: The camera locks at a certain angle. Once it’s set, players can rotate the camera, but it will always maintain a consistent angle to the ground.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.Thumbstic.documentation: Change the movement controller to the thumbstick.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.DPad.documentation: Change the movement controller to the DPad.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.Thumbpad.documentation: Change the movement controller to the thumbpad.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.ClickToMo.documentation: Change the movement controller to click to move.

@roblox/enum/TouchMovementMode.DynamicTh.documentation: Change the movement controller to the dynamic thumbstick.

@roblox/enum/UserCFrame.LeftHand.documentation: The CFrame of the user's left hand.

@roblox/enum/UserCFrame.RightHand.documentation: The CFrame of the user's right hand.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.Begin.documentation: Occurs when an InputObject starts to interact with the game. For example, a mouse button down, or a key down, or when a touch begins touching the screen.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.Change.documentation: Occurs each frame an InputObject has already begun interacting with the game and part of its state is changing. For example, a movement of the mouse position, a gamepad thumbstick, gamepad trigger button, or screen touch point.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.End.documentation: When an InputObject finishes interacting with the game. For example, a mouse button up, or a key up, or when a touch stops touching the screen.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.Cancel.documentation: A special circumstance state that indicates this input is no longer relevant, particularly with ContextActionService. For example, binding two action-handling functions will cause the first to Cancel if an input was already in-progress when the second was bound.

@roblox/enum/UserInputState.None.documentation: A state that should never be seen in a game, essentially just marks the end of the enum.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.MouseMovement.documentation: Movement of the mouse. Fires changed events each time the player's cursor position changes and when the move enters/leaves the game window.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Touch.documentation: A tap on the screen from a mobile device.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.Focus.documentation: The client regaining focus of the Roblox window.

@roblox/enum/UserInputType.TextInput.documentation: Input of Text into a text-based GuiObject. Normally this is only a TextBox.

@roblox/enum/VelocityConstraintMode.Line.documentation: Sets the LinearVelocity object to constrain its velocity to a line.

@roblox/enum/VelocityConstraintMode.Plan.documentation: Sets the LinearVelocity object to constrain its velocity to a plane.

@roblox/enum/VelocityConstraintMode.Vect.documentation: Sets the LinearVelocity object to constrain its velocity to a vector.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpadMode.Touch.documentation: The touchpad is treated as ButtonB if it is the left touchpad, or ButtonA if it is the right touchpad.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpadMode.VirtualThumb.documentation: The touchpad will function as a gamepad joystick.

@roblox/enum/VRTouchpadMode.ABXY.documentation: The touchpad will function as a means of inputting the standard ABXY gamepad input, dividing it up into 4 diagonal pie slices.

@roblox/enum/ZIndexBehavior.Global.documentation: The ZIndex property will override the default value computed from the depth in the hierarchy.

@roblox/enum/ZIndexBehavior.Sibling.documentation: The ZIndex property will control the order that the GuiObject will be rendered relative to its siblings.

@luau/global/bit32.arshift/param/0.documentation: The number whose bits shall be shifted

@luau/global/bit32.arshift/param/1.documentation: The integer number of bits to shift by

@luau/global/debug.traceback/param/0.documentation: The first line of the returned string

@luau/global/debug.traceback/param/1.documentation: The number of calls "up" the call stack to return

@luau/global/debug.info/param/0.documentation: A thread as returned by coroutine.create, omit entirely to use the current thread

@luau/global/debug.info/param/1.documentation: Determines at what function or level of the call stack the information returned should describe

@luau/global/debug.info/param/2.documentation: A string that describes what the returned information should represent. It must only contain 0 or 1 instances of the following characters, each representing a piece of information: slnaf

@luau/global/debug.profilebegin/param/0.documentation: The text that will be displayed on this microprofiler label.

@luau/global/math.log/param/1.documentation: The base of the logarithm, the constant e by default.

@luau/global/os.time/param/0.documentation: A table describing a specific time, similar to that returned by os.date. If not provided, uses the current UTC time.

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/0.documentation: The string whose occurrences of the given pattern shall be replaced

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/1.documentation: The pattern to be matched and replaced

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/2.documentation: Determines what should replace the occurrence(s) of the given pattern

@luau/global/string.gsub/param/3.documentation: The maximum number of substitutions to make

@luau/global/string.split/param/1.documentation: The separator character(s) to be used for splitting the string.

@luau/global/table.clear/param/0.documentation: The table whose keys will be cleared.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/0.documentation: The table that will be converted into a string.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/1.documentation: The string that will be concatenated between each entry in the table.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/2.documentation: The starting index of the table concatenation.

@luau/global/table.concat/param/3.documentation: The ending index of the table concatenation.

@luau/global/table.foreach/param/1.documentation: The function that will be used for the iteration. This function will receive 2 arguments for each iteration, where the 1st argument is the key, and the 2nd argument is the value.

@luau/global/table.foreachi/param/1.documentation: The function that will be used for the iteration. This function will receive 2 arguments for each iteration, where the 1st argument is the index, and the 2nd argument is the value.

@luau/global/table.getn/param/0.documentation: The table whose size is being measured.

@luau/global/table.insert/param/0.documentation: The table that is being appended to.

@luau/global/table.insert/param/1.documentation: The position at which the value will be inserted.

@luau/global/table.insert/param/2.documentation: The value that will be appended to the table.

@luau/global/table.remove/param/0.documentation: The table that is having an element removed.

@luau/global/table.remove/param/1.documentation: The index of the element being removed.

@luau/global/table.sort/param/1.documentation: An optional comparison function to be used when comparing elements in the table. This function receives two elements, a and b, and should return true if a < b.

@roblox/global/task.spawn/param/0.documentation: A function or a thread returned by coroutine.create

@roblox/global/task.spawn/param/1.documentation: Arguments to send to the function or thread

@roblox/global/task.defer/param/0.documentation: A function or a thread returned by coroutine.create

@roblox/global/task.defer/param/1.documentation: Arguments to send to the function or thread

@roblox/global/task.delay/param/0.documentation: The minimum number of seconds that must pass before the function/thread is called/resumed

@roblox/global/task.delay/param/2.documentation: Arguments to be passed to the function/thread when it is due to be called/resumed

@roblox/global/task.wait/param/0.documentation: The amount of time in seconds that should elapse before the current thread is resumed

@luau/global/utf8.codepoint/param/1.documentation: The index of the codepoint that should be fetched from this string.

@luau/global/utf8.codepoint/param/2.documentation: The index of the last codepoint between i and j that will be returned. If excluded, this will default to the value of i.

@luau/global/assert/param/0.documentation: The value that will be asserted against.

@luau/global/assert/param/1.documentation: The text that will be shown in the error if the assertion fails.

@luau/global/collectgarbage/param/0.documentation: The name of the operation that should be performed by the garbage collector.

@luau/global/error/param/1.documentation: The level of information that should be printed. Defaults to 1.

@luau/global/getfenv/param/0.documentation: The stack level (int) of the environment to be returned; or the function whose environment will be returned

@luau/global/getmetatable/param/0.documentation: The object to fetch the metatable of.

@luau/global/ipairs/param/0.documentation: A table whose elements are to be iterated over.

@luau/global/loadstring/param/0.documentation: The specified string to be loaded as Lua code.

@luau/global/next/param/1.documentation: The last key that was previously retrieved from a call to next.

@luau/global/pairs/param/0.documentation: A table whose elements are to be iterated over.

@luau/global/pcall/param/0.documentation: The function to be called in protected mode.

@luau/global/pcall/param/1.documentation: The arguments to send to func when executing.

@luau/global/print/param/0.documentation: Any number of arguments to be outputted.

@luau/global/rawset/param/1.documentation: The index to set in t to a specified value. Must be different from nil.

@luau/global/rawset/param/2.documentation: The value to be set to a specified index in table t.

@luau/global/select/overload/(int, Tuple.documentation: The index of the argument to return all arguments after in args.

@luau/global/select/overload/(string, Tu.documentation: Must be "#" to use select in this way

@luau/global/setfenv/param/0.documentation: Either a function or a number that specifies the function at that stack level.

@luau/global/setfenv/param/1.documentation: The function environment table to set for the specified function.

@luau/global/setmetatable/param/0.documentation: The table to set the metatable of.

@luau/global/setmetatable/param/1.documentation: If nil, the metatable of the given table t is removed. Otherwise, the metatable to set for the given table t.

@luau/global/tonumber/param/0.documentation: The object to be converted into a number.

@luau/global/tostring/param/0.documentation: The object to be converted into a string.

@luau/global/type/param/0.documentation: The object to return the type of.

@luau/global/unpack/param/0.documentation: The list of elements to be unpacked.

@luau/global/xpcall/param/0.documentation: The function to be called in protected mode.

@luau/global/xpcall/param/1.documentation: The function to be used as an error handle if xpcall catches an error.

@roblox/global/delay/param/0.documentation: The amount of time that this function will be queued before being executed.

@roblox/global/delay/param/1.documentation: The function that will be executed once delayTime seconds have passed.

@roblox/global/LoadLibrary/param/0.documentation: The name of the library that should be loaded in.

@roblox/global/require/param/0.documentation: The ModuleScript that will be executed to retrieve the return value it provides.

@roblox/global/typeof/param/0.documentation: The Lua type that will have its type checked.

@roblox/global/wait/param/0.documentation: Specifies how long the thread should yield for.

@roblox/global/warn/param/0.documentation: This function accepts any number of arguments, and will attempt to convert them into strings which will then be joined together with spaces between them.
